description:
This is the entry-level module for a sound education in modern mathematics, to prepare students for higher
level mathematics courses. The first goal is to build the necessary mathematical foundation by introducing
the basic language, concepts, and methods of contemporary mathematics, with focus on discrete and
algebraic notions. The second goal is to develop student’s ability to construct rigorous arguments and
formal proofs based on logical reasoning. Main topics: logic, sets, maps, equivalence relations, natural
numbers, integers, rational numbers, congruences, counting and cardinality. Major results include:
binomial theorem, fundamental theorem of arithmetic, infinitude of primes, Chinese remainder theorem,
Fermat-Euler theorem.
title: Basic Discrete Mathematics
